poem:
### In the Wake of Retaliation

Planes hum through  
shadows of Amsterdam,  
each wing a whisper  
of men trembling—  
and in Tehran,  
old walls cradle  
echoes of restraint,  
as hands hover  
over ancient maps,  
waiting for silence  
to seep like dusk  
through boundaries  
of impulse—  
a quiet pause  
between storms.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israel sends rescue planes to Amsterdam after attacks on football fans – Middle East crisis live 8.57am GMT Khamenei aide warns against impulsive Iran response to Israel attack An adviser to Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has warned against launching an “instinctive” response to Israeli airstrikes on the Islamic republic last month, reports AFP. Israeli warplanes struck military sites in Iran on 26 October in retaliation for a large Iranian missile attack on Israel". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Israel sends rescue planes to Amsterdam after attacks on football fans – Middle East crisis live 8.57am GMT Khamenei aide warns against impulsive Iran response to Israel attack An adviser to Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has warned against launching an “instinctive” response to Israeli airstrikes on the Islamic republic last month, reports AFP. Israeli warplanes struck military sites in Iran on 26 October in retaliation for a large Iranian missile attack on Israel
